awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences: Laws of the Iterated Logarithm and   Strong Approximations
awd_abstract_narration: The principal investigator is working on problems in                       probability theory concerning the law of the iterated logarithms                (LIL) and strong approximations.  In particular, the                            investigator will work on convergence rates in the LIL in Hilbert               spaces, infinite dimensional versions of the Darling-Erdos                      theorem and Chung type LIL's, and strong approximations for sums                of independent Banach space value random variables.                                  Properties of sums of independent random variables have                    been of interest to probabilists and statisticians for a long                   time.  The law of the iterated logarithm gives a very precise                   bound on how fast a sum of random variables grows.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
